description: Ohara is an island in the West Blue renowned for its vast library and community of scholars dedicated to studying history and archaeology. The island is home to the Tree of Knowledge, a massive tree containing the world's largest collection of books and historical records.

keyEvents.title: Ohara Introduced in Flashback
keyEvents.description: The island of Ohara is introduced through flashbacks set 20 years before the main story, showing it as a peaceful scholarly community where young Robin lived.
keyEvents.significance: Ohara is established as Robin's homeland and a center of archaeological knowledge, setting the stage for the tragic events that will shape her life.

keyEvents.title: Robin Becomes Youngest Archaeologist on Ohara
keyEvents.description: Eight-year-old Robin passes her archaeology exam on Ohara, becoming the youngest archaeologist in the island's history.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates Ohara's academic prestige and Robin's exceptional intellect within this scholarly community.

keyEvents.title: Jaguar D. Saul Arrives on Ohara
keyEvents.description: The giant Jaguar D. Saul washes ashore on Ohara's beach, marking a fateful arrival that will impact the island's future.
keyEvents.significance: Saul's arrival on Ohara connects the Marines to the island and foreshadows the coming tragedy.

geographicalFeatures: Sandy beaches where Saul washed ashore
The Tree of Knowledge at the island's center
Residential areas where scholars and families lived
culturalSignificance: Ohara is the world's premier center for archaeological research and historical study. The scholars of Ohara are renowned for their dedication to preserving and understanding history, though their research into the forbidden Void Century makes them targets of the World Government.

historicalEvents.event: Robin becomes youngest archaeologist in history
historicalEvents.significance: Marks Robin's exceptional achievement and integration into Ohara's scholarly community

historicalEvents.event: Jaguar D. Saul arrives on the island
historicalEvents.significance: Sets in motion events that will lead to Ohara's destruction

trivia: Ohara's name may reference the Japanese word for 'small field' or could be a reference to the historical Irish kingdom of O'Hara
The island is located in the West Blue, the same sea where many significant characters originate
Ohara's scholarly tradition and eventual fate parallel real-world instances of knowledge centers being destroyed throughout history

description: The Tree of Knowledge is a massive, ancient tree located on Ohara that houses the world's largest library. Its interior contains countless books and historical records collected over centuries by Ohara's scholars. The tree serves as both a natural wonder and the center of archaeological research.

keyEvents.title: Tree of Knowledge Shown as Scholarly Center
keyEvents.description: The Tree of Knowledge is revealed as the location where Robin takes and passes her archaeology examination, housing Ohara's vast collection of knowledge.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the Tree of Knowledge as a symbol of humanity's pursuit of understanding and the physical manifestation of Ohara's scholarly mission.

keyEvents.title: Forbidden Research Conducted in the Tree
keyEvents.description: Professor Clover reveals that the scholars are conducting forbidden research about the Void Century within the Tree of Knowledge, research that is illegal according to World Government law.
keyEvents.significance: The Tree of Knowledge becomes the epicenter of dangerous truth-seeking that will attract the World Government's wrath.

geographicalFeatures: Massive ancient tree with a hollow interior
Multi-level library within the tree's trunk
Vast collection of books and historical documents
culturalSignificance: The Tree of Knowledge represents humanity's accumulated wisdom and the pursuit of truth. It symbolizes the belief that knowledge should be preserved and shared, even when that knowledge challenges authority. The tree's eventual fate becomes a powerful commentary on the suppression of information.

historicalEvents.event: Robin passes archaeology exam inside the Tree
historicalEvents.significance: Marks Robin's official entry into Ohara's scholarly community at age 8

historicalEvents.event: Scholars continue forbidden Void Century research
historicalEvents.significance: The ongoing research will lead to the World Government's intervention

trivia: The Tree of Knowledge is a reference to the biblical Tree of Knowledge of Good and Evil, representing forbidden understanding
The tree's design as a natural library emphasizes the organic, fundamental nature of knowledge and learning
The Tree of Knowledge contains research materials about the Void Century, making it one of the most dangerous locations in the world from the World Government's perspective

region: Paradise (First Half of the Grand Line)
description: Enies Lobby is a judicial island controlled by the World Government, serving as one of three major government strongholds. It functions as a courthouse where the accused are brought before being sent to Impel Down prison.

keyEvents.title: Spandam Threatens Robin at Enies Lobby
keyEvents.description: In the present timeline, Spandam holds Robin captive at Enies Lobby and threatens her with the Golden Den Den Mushi that can summon a Buster Call.
keyEvents.significance: Enies Lobby serves as the framing location for Robin's flashback, connecting her past trauma with Buster Calls to her present captivity.

geographicalFeatures: Gates of Justice connecting to Marine Headquarters and Impel Down
culturalSignificance: Enies Lobby represents the absolute justice of the World Government. No accused person has ever been declared innocent at Enies Lobby, making it a symbol of the government's uncompromising authority.
